resources.string: Please read the following to understand the concept of logs, plans and rules:
A good starting point are some preconfigured rule sets available on the website. Just import them via import menu and play around.
If you managed to set up a common plan for your country, do not hesitate to export your rule set to me by mail. I will put it on the website to make it available for all the users.
There are three kinds of data structures:
Logs to save information about your calls, messages and traffic statistics.
Plans to describe all kinds of aspects of your bill.
Rules to match the logs and move them to a particular plan.
You can add or delete plans just as you want. You can set the order by dragging them around with the handle on the right of the list view.

To edit a plan, you just need to click it. At the next screen, you can set all kind of settings. There are a few, most users won\'t need. But some do. A short help for each setting is displayed in this view. Most settings you do not understand are not used in your country. Just leave them as they are. ;)
You can merge plans to aggregate their log items to a combined cost and limit.
Edit the rules in the same way. Each rule does match some log items and move them to a plan in which the logs should be billed in.
But keep in mind, that order is important for rules:
Logs are matched top-down, means: the first rule that matches will stop processing of this particular log item.
E.g.: If you match all calls to 0800% numbers to a \"free\" plan with the first rule, there is no need to exclude these numbers in the second.
